verses.verse: For I,’ says the LORD, ‘will be ((Is. 26:1)) a wall of fire all around her, ((Is. 60:19)) and I will be the glory in her midst.’ ”
Future Joy of Zion and Many Nations “Up, up! Flee (Is. 48:20) from the land of the north,” says the LORD; “for I have (Deut. 28:64) spread you abroad like the four winds of heaven,” says the LORD.
“Up, Zion! (Is. 48:20; Jer. 51:6; (Rev. 18:4)) Escape, you who dwell with the daughter of Babylon.”
For thus says the LORD of hosts: “He sent Me after glory, to the nations which plunder you; for he who (Deut. 32:10; Ps. 17:8) touches you touches the apple of His eye.
For surely I will (Is. 19:16) shake My hand against them, and they shall become spoil for their servants. Then (Zech. 4:9) you will know that the LORD of hosts has sent Me.
(Is. 12:6) “Sing and rejoice, O daughter of Zion! For behold, I am coming and I ((Lev. 26:12)) will dwell in your midst,” says the LORD.

((Is. 2:2, 3)) “Many nations shall be joined to the LORD (Zech. 3:10) in that day, and they shall become (Ex. 12:49) My people. And I will dwell in your midst. Then (Ezek. 33:33) you will know that the LORD of hosts has sent Me to you.
And the LORD will ((Deut. 32:9); Ps. 33:12; Jer. 10:16) take possession of Judah as His inheritance in the Holy Land, and will again choose Jerusalem.
(Hab. 2:20; Zeph. 1:7) Be silent, all flesh, before the LORD, for He is aroused (Ps. 68:5) from His holy habitation!”

Vision of the High Priest Then he showed me (Ezra 5:2; Hag. 1:1; Zech. 6:11) Joshua the high priest standing before the Angel of the LORD, and (1 Chr. 21:1; Job 1:6; Ps. 109:6; (Rev. 12:9, 10)) Satan standing at his right hand to oppose him.
